ygData.msgSnippet: I m trying to make a crawl to gather some articles about us today, but I can t get Heritrix 0.10.0 to accept my User-Agent and From fields.  Now I know other

Subject: Stupid crawl problems:  User-Agent and From

X-Yahoo-Profile: lrclause

I'm trying to make a crawl to gather some articles about us today, but I
can't get Heritrix 0.10.0 to accept my User-Agent and From fields.  Now
I know other people have been running them, so it must work, but I see
no clue abot what goes wrong.  The relevant part of the crawl order is

<map name="http-headers">
<string name="user-agent">linux-heritrix/0.10.0 (http://www.netarkivet.dk/)</string>
<string name="from">lc@...</string>
</map>

and the error message is

A fatal InitializationException occured when loading job:
You must set the User-Agent and From HTTP header values to acceptable strings. 
 User-Agent: [software-name](+[info-url])[misc]
 From: [email-address]
: org.archive.crawler.framework.exceptions.FatalConfigurationException: unacceptable user-agent or from

I tried with http://www.netarkivet.dk or www.netarkivet.dk as URL.

For future users, it would be nice if a) the little pop-up helps show an
example of accepted style, and/or b) the error message showed what
Heritrix got and found offending.

-Lars
